frame.name: Abundance
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Quantity</fen> of a <fen>Collection</fen> occurring in a <fen>Place</fen> has a particular <fen>Measure</fen>. The <fen>Measure</fen> of the <fen>Collection</fen> is referred to only in terms of how the <fen>Measure</fen> diverges from a norm for <fen>Collection</fen>s of the specified type. <fen>Degree</fen> may further refine the relation of the <fen>Measure</fen> to the norm.
<ex><fex name="Collection">Beauty</fex> <m>is</m> <t>abundant</t> <fex name="pla">in a land flowing with snowmelt</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Detritus of life <t>abounds</t> <fex name="pla">in the atmosphere</fex>. </ex>
<ex>There was a recent discovery that <fex name="Collection">exotic microbes</fex> <t>teem</t> <fex name="pla">in the rocks hundreds of metres beneath the floor of the Pacific Ocean</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Collection
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Collection</fen> whose <fen>Quantity</fen> is under consideration.
<ex>Extension brings <fex name="Collection">projects</fex> <t>galore</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Quantity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The feature of an <fen>Collection</fen> which is under discussion. This FE is incorporated by all the lexical units in this frame.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Measure</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Collection</fen>.
<ex>For those who manage to make their way onto the lakes, waterfowl is <fex name="deg">very</fex> <t>abundant</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Collection</fen> is in the state of having a particular <fen>Measure</fen> for the <fen>Quantity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Measure
FE.definition: <def-root>The measure of the <fen>Quantity</fen>, which is incorporated by the lexical units.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Collection</fen> occurs.
<ex>Maggots began to <t>teem</t> <fex name="pla">in his black fur</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: abound.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: exist in large numbers or amounts.
